meanings.definition: A person who maintains the status quo and resists change.
meanings.sent1: The standpatters in the group were against any new ideas.
meanings.sent2: The standpatters at the meeting were hesitant to consider different approaches.
meanings.sent3: The standpatters in the office always preferred things to stay the same.
meanings.sent4: Her father was a standpatter, rooted in his ways like an old oak tree.
meanings.sent5: The standpatters in the town council were like anchors, holding back progress.

meanings.definition: Those who adhere to traditional or conservative beliefs and practices.
meanings.sent1: The standpatters in the community cherished old customs and rituals.
meanings.sent2: The standpatters in the family insisted on following age-old traditions.
meanings.sent3: Despite their young age, the children were already standpatters in their views.
meanings.sent4: She saw the standpatters as guardians of the past, preserving heritage.
meanings.sent5: The standpatters in the village were like time capsules, holding onto history.
